Question: What is the name of your hyperconverged infrastructure project?
Guidance: Provide internal project reference name

Question: Who is the primary stakeholder for this VxRail HCI project?
Guidance: Name, role, and decision-making authority (typically VP Infrastructure or IT Director)
Notes: Main point of contact and decision authority

Question: What infrastructure challenges are you trying to solve with VxRail HCI?
Guidance: Common challenges: Aging SAN end-of-life, Complex storage management, Slow VM provisioning, High support costs, Data center footprint, Multi-vendor finger-pointing
Notes: Primary business driver for HCI investment

Question: What is your current virtualization and storage infrastructure?
Guidance: Describe: VMware vSphere version, SAN vendor (EMC NetApp Dell), Server vendor, Storage capacity, Pain points

Question: How many virtual machines are currently running?
Guidance: Typical ranges: <100 VMs, 100-250 VMs, 250-500 VMs, 500-1000 VMs, 1000+ VMs
Notes: Determines VxRail cluster size and scale

Question: What applications and workloads run in your virtual environment?
Guidance: Common workloads: File servers, Web servers, Databases (SQL Oracle), VDI (Horizon Citrix), ERP, CRM, Email (Exchange)
Notes: Workload classification drives sizing and performance

Question: What are your primary goals for deploying VxRail HCI?
Guidance: Common goals: Simplify operations, Reduce TCO, Eliminate SAN complexity, Faster VM provisioning, Single vendor support, Data center consolidation

Question: How will you measure VxRail deployment success?
Guidance: Define KPIs: TCO reduction %, 99.9%+ uptime, VM provisioning time (minutes vs days), Operational FTE reduction, Single vendor support

Question: What is your expected timeline for VxRail deployment and VM migration?
Guidance: Typical ranges: 4-6 weeks (design + deploy), 6-8 weeks (with migration), 8-12 weeks (large enterprise)

Question: What is your approved budget range for HCI infrastructure?
Guidance: Common ranges: $300K-$600K (4-node), $600K-$1M (8-node), $1M-$2M (16+ node). Include hardware software support

Question: What are your current annual infrastructure costs to compare against?
Guidance: Include: SAN support, Server support, VMware licenses, Power/cooling, Admin labor, Replacement CapEx
Notes: TCO baseline for cost comparison analysis

Question: How do you expect VM count and capacity to change over 3 years?
Guidance: Provide current VM count and projected annual growth rate (10%, 25%, 50%)

Question: What VMware vSphere version are you currently running?
Guidance: Common versions: vSphere 6.5/6.7 (upgrade required), vSphere 7.0, vSphere 8.0 (current)

Question: What VMware licensing do you currently have?
Guidance: Licenses: vSphere Standard, Enterprise, Enterprise Plus (required for vSAN). Can reuse existing or purchase new
Notes: vSphere license reuse or new purchase

Question: What VxRail cluster size do you prefer?
Guidance: Cluster options: 4-node (entry), 6-node, 8-node (recommended), 12-16 node (large), Start small and expand

Question: What VxRail node model fits your performance requirements?
Guidance: Models: E560 (hybrid SSD), E565 (all-flash NVMe), P570 (all-NVMe performance), D560 (dense storage), G560 (GPU workloads)
Notes: Node selection based on performance and capacity

Question: What total usable storage capacity is required?
Guidance: Calculate: Current data + 3-year growth + 30% buffer. vSAN deduplication/compression provides 2-3x savings. Account for FTT=1 mirroring (50% overhead)
Notes: Storage capacity planning with vSAN efficiency

Question: How many total vCPUs are required for all VMs?
Guidance: Calculate: Sum of VM vCPUs. Typical 4:1 oversubscription acceptable. Account for N+1 or N+2 failover capacity

Question: How much total RAM is required for all VMs?
Guidance: Calculate: Sum of VM RAM + 30% buffer + ESXi overhead. Account for N+1 failover capacity

Question: What network connectivity is required?
Guidance: Network: 10GbE adequate, 25GbE recommended for vSAN, Dual 10/25GbE for redundancy, ToR switch integration

Question: What vSAN features are required?
Guidance: Features: Deduplication and compression (standard), Encryption at rest, Stretched cluster (DR), RAID-5/6 erasure coding (6+ nodes)

Question: What backup solution will you use with VxRail?
Guidance: Common: Veeam Backup & Replication, Dell IDPA (Integrated Data Protection Appliance), Commvault, Rubrik, Cohesity, Native vSphere snapshots

Question: Do you need disaster recovery replication to second site?
Guidance: DR options: No DR, VMware SRM (Site Recovery Manager), vSphere Replication, Array-based replication, RecoverPoint for VMs

Question: Can you reuse existing VMware infrastructure during migration?
Guidance: Migration options: Parallel run (keep old SAN during migration), vMotion VMs to VxRail, Lift-and-shift cutover, Green-field deployment

Question: What management and monitoring tools are required?
Guidance: Management: vCenter Server (standard), vRealize Operations (recommended), vRealize Log Insight, VxRail Manager, Dell OpenManage

Question: Do you require all-flash (NVMe) or is hybrid SSD acceptable?
Guidance: All-flash: Higher performance and density. Hybrid: Lower cost with SSD cache + HDD capacity tier. Most choose all-flash

Question: What is the highest data classification in VMs?
Guidance: Levels: Public, Internal, Confidential, Restricted, Regulated (HIPAA PCI FedRAMP)

Question: Is vSAN encryption at rest required?
Guidance: Encryption: Not required, vSAN encryption (FIPS 140-2), VM-level encryption, Both vSAN and VM encryption

Question: What compliance standards must the infrastructure meet?
Guidance: Common standards: SOC 2, ISO 27001, PCI DSS, HIPAA, FedRAMP, GDPR

Question: What authentication and authorization requirements apply?
Guidance: Options: vCenter local accounts, Active Directory/LDAP, vSphere SSO, MFA, Certificate-based, RBAC roles

Question: What audit and compliance logging is required?
Guidance: Requirements: vCenter audit logs, vSAN event logs, VM access logs, SIEM integration (Splunk QRadar), Retention (1 year 3 years 7 years)
Notes: Audit trail and compliance reporting needs

Question: Where will VxRail be deployed?
Guidance: Options: On-premises data center, Colocation facility, Branch office, ROBO (remote office), Multi-site

Question: What power and cooling capacity is available?
Guidance: VxRail 4-node cluster: ~12-16kW (3-4kW per node). Ensure adequate 208/240V circuits and HVAC cooling capacity

Question: How much rack space is available?
Guidance: VxRail nodes: 2U per node (4-node = 8U, 8-node = 16U). Include ToR switches (2U) and UPS. Plan 12-20U total
Notes: Physical space and rack elevation planning

Question: How many virtualization administrators manage VMware?
Guidance: Team size: 1-2 admins (small), 3-5 admins (medium), 6+ admins (large enterprise)
Notes: Support team size and training requirements

Question: What is your team's experience with VMware vSphere?
Guidance: Experience: Basic (vCenter GUI), Intermediate (vMotion DRS HA), Advanced (optimization troubleshooting), Expert (VCAP/VCDX)
Notes: vSphere skill level and training needs

Question: What is your team's experience with VMware vSAN?
Guidance: Experience: None (SAN only), Basic (vSAN concepts), Intermediate (vSAN administration), Advanced (performance tuning troubleshooting)

Question: What uptime requirements do you have for virtual infrastructure?
Guidance: SLA: Best-effort 99% (no HA), Business 99.9% (N+1 HA), Mission-critical 99.99% (N+2 or stretched cluster)

Question: What maintenance windows are acceptable for updates?
Guidance: Change windows: Monthly patching window, Quarterly updates, Annual hardware refresh, Zero-downtime (rolling upgrades)
Notes: Change management and VxRail Lifecycle Manager

Question: What monitoring and alerting is required?
Guidance: Monitoring: vCenter alarms, vRealize Operations, vSAN health checks, Dell OpenManage, Email/SNMP alerts

Question: What support coverage do you require from Dell?
Guidance: Options: ProSupport (NBD), ProSupport Plus (4-hour), Mission Critical (2-hour with TAM), 24x7 phone support

Question: Who will be the technical lead for VxRail deployment?
Guidance: Name, role, contact information (Virtualization Manager, Infrastructure Architect)

Question: What internal resources are available for deployment and migration?
Guidance: List team members, roles, and time commitment (hours per week)

Question: Do you need Dell ProDeploy services for installation?
Guidance: ProDeploy: Rack installation, Cable management, Initial configuration, vSphere setup, Knowledge transfer. Recommended for first VxRail deployment
Notes: Professional services and on-site support needs

Question: What pilot VMs or applications will validate VxRail performance?
Guidance: Pilot selection: Non-critical VMs (file servers), Dev/test environment, Specific application tier, 10-20% of total VMs

Question: What migration method do you prefer for VMs?
Guidance: Options: vMotion (zero-downtime for VMware VMs), Cold migration (shutdown and move), Backup and restore, New builds

Question: When will legacy SAN be decommissioned?
Guidance: Timing: Immediately after migration, Parallel run for 30 days, Keep SAN for secondary storage, Retire after VxRail proven

Question: What training will be needed for virtualization team?
Guidance: Training: vSphere 8.0 (if upgrading), vSAN administration, VxRail Lifecycle Manager, Troubleshooting and optimization

Question: What documentation is required for handover?
Guidance: Deliverables: Architecture diagram (network storage compute), IP address plan, vSphere configuration, Runbooks, Troubleshooting guides

Question: What testing is required before production migration?
Guidance: Testing: vSAN performance (IOmeter), vMotion validation, HA failover, Backup and restore, Application performance

Question: What criteria must be met before VxRail is production-ready?
Guidance: Examples: Pilot VMs performing well, Team trained, Backup operational, Monitoring configured, 99.9% uptime demonstrated

Question: What are your concerns about transitioning from SAN to vSAN?
Guidance: Common concerns: vSAN maturity and stability, Performance vs dedicated SAN, Learning curve for team, Vendor lock-in (VMware)

Question: What if you need more capacity than initially deployed?
Guidance: Options: Add VxRail nodes non-disruptively (up to 64-node cluster), Add capacity-only nodes, Separate cluster for new workloads

Question: What is your tolerance for hardware node failures?
Guidance: VxRail N+1: Tolerate 1 node failure. N+2: Tolerate 2 concurrent failures. Assess impact on performance and capacity
Notes: Failure mode analysis and HA design

Question: What is your biggest concern about VM migration to VxRail?
Guidance: Common: Downtime impact, Application compatibility, Performance regressions, Data loss risk, Rollback procedures

Question: What is your biggest concern about managing VxRail?
Guidance: Common: vSAN troubleshooting, Performance tuning, Capacity planning, Lifecycle management, Vendor support quality
Notes: Skill development and external support needs

Question: What is your current annual SAN support cost?
Guidance: Calculate: SAN maintenance contract + disk shelf expansion + SAN admin labor. Example: EMC Unity $50K/year + $30K admin = $80K
Notes: Baseline for cost savings and TCO analysis

Question: What are your current annual server and VMware costs?
Guidance: Include: Server hardware support, vSphere licenses (if EA), Compute admin labor

Question: What infrastructure costs will VxRail eliminate?
Guidance: Avoided costs: SAN support, Separate server/storage purchases, Multi-vendor complexity, Power/cooling for SAN, Admin labor

Question: What ROI timeline and payback period are you targeting?
Guidance: VxRail typically achieves ROI in 24-36 months through operational cost avoidance and SAN elimination

Question: Do you have preferences around CapEx vs OpEx spending?
Guidance: Consider: VxRail upfront purchase (CapEx), Dell Financial Services leasing (converts to OpEx), Budget approval processes
